description: Dive into "Antalya's Coastal Paradise: Beach Bliss Awaits" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Antalya's Coastal Paradise: Beach Bliss Awaits

places.generalDescription: Konyaaltƒ± Beaches in Antalya offer a picturesque setting with crystal-clear waters and stunning surroundings, making it an ideal spot for sunbathing, swimming, and enjoying fresh seafood. The well-equipped beach provides amenities such as sun loungers, umbrellas, beach bars, and restaurants. Visitors can also partake in water sports like jet skiing and parasailing. Additionally, the area is known for its large all-inclusive hotels that boast top-notch facilities.

sources.snippet: Known as the Turkish Riviera, Antalya is a popular destination for sun-seekers and beach enthusiasts. In this post we explore 14 beaches you have to see in Antalya!. From Konyalti Beach‚Äôs white sand with crystal clear water near Istanbul all the way south to Lara Beach on Mediterranean coast, these are some of Turkey‚Äôs most beautiful destinations that offer something special for everyone.
sources.shortName: The Ultimate Guide To The Best 14 Antalya Beaches

sources.snippet: Located in the west of Antalya and nestled near the Taurus Mountains, Konyaaltƒ± Beach boasts an expansive 8-kilometer-long and 50-meter-wide coastline that stretches from Beach Park to the trade port. This stunning beach is easily accessible from five mini-districts within Konyaaltƒ±. A picturesque promenade and the bustling Akdeniz Highway run parallel to the shore.
sources.shortName: Best beaches in Antalya

sources.snippet: The Konyaalti Beach is one of the most popular, with its wide stretch of soft golden sand and crystal clear water. Another popular beach in the area is the Lara Beach, which is known for its fine sand and calm waters. Other popular beaches in the Antalya area include the Mermerli Beach and the Karpuzkaldiran Beach.
sources.shortName: The Best Beaches in Antalya

sources.snippet: Konyaalti beach is a popular holiday destination in Antalya Turkey along the shores of the Eastern Mediterranean sea. It features a long pebble each which stretches from the center of Antalya‚Äôs city center all the way to the western outskirts. Here is all you need to know to make the best of your visit to‚Ä¶
sources.shortName: Your guide to uncovering Antalya's secrets

sources.snippet: Konyaalti Beach, Antalya, is easily one of the most popular beaches in all of Antalya if not one of the best beaches in Turkey. Honestly, it‚Äôs not difficult to see why ‚Äì it has everything going for it. All you need is to see a photograph of it, and I guarantee you‚Äôll already be on your way out the door!
sources.shortName: 18 Epic Beaches In Antalya

sources.snippet: Casa Sur‚Äôs Tips: Konyaaltƒ± Beach is  one of the best places to feel the local, chill vibe. It is a public beach with a lenght of 7 km, you may enjoy the sun and the sea by laying your towel on the beach of pebbles and have a walk with the spectacular mountaion view. Konyaaltƒ± Beach, Ku≈ükavaƒüƒ±
sources.shortName: The most beautiful beaches of Antalya

sources.snippet: One of the best beaches in Antalya Turkey where travelers get stunning views of nature, Konyaalti Beach is tucked between the cliffs and the Beydaƒülarƒ± mountains. It is, in fact, one of the longest Antalya beaches and has enough space for you to enjoy your time on the beach.
sources.shortName: 8 Beaches In Antalya That Make For A Perfect Family Getaway

sources.snippet: Mermerli Beach is located right in the historic center of Antalya, next to the Kalei√ßi Harbor behind a cliff. It was once used as a women‚Äôs beach since it‚Äôs a bit isolated. But it then evolved into a beach for all city dwellers, and became a lifesaver for them in the heat.
sources.shortName: ANTALYA BEACHES - WHERE TO SWIM IN ANTALYA

sources.snippet: Konyaalti Beach is a favorite for locals and tourists alike, thanks to its stunning backdrop of mountains and a well-maintained promenade that hosts shops, parks, and restaurants. Its pebbly shores and crystal-clear waters make it perfect for swimming and water sports.
sources.shortName: Discover the Top 10 Must-Visit Beaches in Antalya

sources.snippet: Located in Antalya, Konyaalti Beach is the longest pebble beach in the Antalya province. The beach stretches 7km from the cliffs to the base of the mountains. Stroll along the boardwalk where you can sit while the kids play or head to a local caf√© for lunch.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Beaches in Antalya, Turkey & Map 2024

sources.snippet: Well, Antalya is the best place for those who love surfing on the blue waters of the sea and diving deeper to discover the hidden wilderness. Here are some of the best-picked beaches you can add to your Wishlist.
sources.shortName: Top 8 Beaches In Antalya Offering A Perfect Getaway For Beach Lovers

sources.snippet: But it is famous for being the beach with the longest coastline. It was also closed to the vehicle traffic. It is a huge beach consisting of at least 5 beaches and all are blue-flagged.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Antalya, Where to Swim? ‚ÄìToursce

sources.snippet: Konyaalti is well known for its central location and coast spreading on the Mediterranean Sea, with various social and entertaining activities, markets, and a modern transport network.
sources.shortName: Explore the most prominent beaches of Antalya

sources.snippet: Konyaaltƒ± Beach is also among the most popular beaches inthe city. Crowded with people both during day and night, it has a lovely seaand it‚Äôs also an ideal spot for water sports.
sources.shortName: Advice for First Time Visitors to Antalya: Antalya Beaches Akka Blog
Discovering Antalya‚Äôs Beaches: A Comprehensive Guide
The best beach of Antalya I Konyaalti Beach
20 BEST BEACHES IN ANTALYA

places.name: Konyaaltƒ± Beaches

reviews.text: A local recommended this beach, and it did not disappoint! üåä‚ú® It had stunning views of the cliffed edges and ended with a breathtaking sight of the mountains. Since we visited in February, we even got to see snow on the mountain peaks, making it even more special ‚ùÑÔ∏èüèîÔ∏è. The only downside is that the sand isn't golden, but overall, it was a beautiful experience! üòä

I visited Konyaalti Beach on the morning of Saturday, May 24. The water was surprisingly warm and crystal-clear - truly inviting! There were no waves, making it absolutely perfect for swimming. The beach holds a Blue Flag certification, ensuring excellent water quality and cleanliness. The stunning Beydaƒülarƒ± Mountains in the background create a breathtaking view. With well-maintained facilities and nearby cafes, it's a fantastic spot for both relaxation and great photos. Highly recommended!

A stunning beach right in the heart of Antalya. It's popular with both locals and tourists, with plenty of beach chairs, bars, cafes, restaurants, and fast food options lining the sandy shore.

Even at 6am, the area is full of life with people swimming, paddle boarding, exercising, or just relaxing and taking in the view. There's also a lift available if you're coming from the top of the cliff or prefer not to walk down the road

places.generalDescription: Kaputa≈ü Beach is a stunning sandy cove located just a short bus ride away from Kalkan. Nestled at the base of a striking mountain gorge, this tiny beach offers clear blue waters and is accessible via a narrow stairway with around 300 steps. Nearby, there are several other beautiful beaches such as Patara Beach, which is part of a national park and known for its 12-kilometer stretch of sand and turtle sightings.
places.name: Kaputa≈ü Beach

reviews.text: Beautiful beach, but a little bit crowded. Finding a parking spot along the road is difficult. You have to pay entrance fee 50 TL. If you don't want to pay for sunbed and umbrella there's a space on the left side on the beach where you can set up your camp üòâ

The photo is FEBRUARY!
The beach in winter had an incredible atmosphere. Quiet and empty. All views and nature just for you.

In summer there are sunbeds, a lot of people relax bar-restaurant. There are showers.

In summer there are sunbeds, a lot of people relax bar-restaurant. There are showers.

I've traveled to many coastal towns, but the sea in Ka≈ü is by far the most stunning. Crystal-clear water, breathtaking views, and a feeling of pure serenity - it's a destination that I'll always recommend!! It's like a painting come to life - turquoise, deep blue, and sparkling under the sunlight. It feels untouched and natural, making it one of the most magical experiences I've had traveling ü•πü´∂üèæü´∂üèæ

places.generalDescription: √áƒ±ralƒ± Beach is a stunning and expansive rustic beach with a mix of sand and small pebbles. In the summer, it's home to sea turtle nests, adding to its natural charm. The beach stretches all along the cove to the Olympos antique site on its western edge. The sandy back transitions into pebbly and rocky shores, leading to crystal-clear waters thanks to the rocky sea bottom.
places.name: √áƒ±ralƒ± Beach

reviews.text: lovely beach! there aren't any public facilities or much shade but the water has a great temperature and there's a lot of space. there are sunbeds and umbrellas that probably belong to the restaurants and hotels right by the beach.

The beach and sea in Cirali are clean, but there is one thing....these are the people. Cigarette butts are everywhere, plastic is lying around in tons on the sand, bottles, cans and napkins....horrible...despite the fact that 90% of vacationers in Cirali are Turks. Incredible

Aprox 3.3km of beach with beautiful mountains and clear water. The sand is hot so shoes all the time for protection.
Water entrance pretty abrupt so it is recommended that kids know how to swim.

places.generalDescription: Kalypso Beach, located in the stunning Konyaaltƒ± area of Antalya, is a vibrant beach club that promises an unforgettable seaside experience. With its lively atmosphere filled with music and expertly crafted cocktails, it's the perfect spot for sun-seekers looking to unwind. The beach club offers comfortable sunbeds and a delightful restaurant serving a variety of delicious dishes, including fresh seafood and exquisite fruit platters.
places.name: Kalypso Beach Club, Antalya - Restaurant & Cocktail Bar

reviews.text:
One of the nicest beaches to visit in Antalya. This is a pebble beach so bring suitable footwear. But we visited a few times and really enjoyed this beach. It was super clean and the seating arrangement was perfect along with great food options and drinks to enjoy at the beach.

Service was attentive and facilities were clean and easily accessible. Would definitely revisit and come back here again. One of the best places to visit in Antalya. Although it's marketed as a beach club great family day out too.

Amazing experience!! Must visit if you aren't staying at any of the all inclusive resorts with a beach. The beach is a pebble one but clean and not at all difficult to walk/sit. The club itself has excellent service, not too loud of music, we spent the entire day and had a great time. Food and drinks were good. Kudos to Ibrahim for his hospitality, he was fantastic! Knows how to make a customer feel happy. Cheers to him!

I visited this private beach twice and overall really enjoyed it. Comfortable beds, delicious food, affordable prices, and great summer vibes with live DJ music. Staff works hard ‚Äì special thanks to Selin for her excellent service, and the kind hostess who speaks Russian and Ukrainian.

One downside was an unprofessional waiter, though after my complaint another waiter apologised and brought complimentary coffee, which was nice.

Pros: comfortable beds, great atmosphere, good service, tasty food, affordable prices.
Cons: staff sometimes smoke near guest beds, occasional lack of professionalism, and towels are not included in the bed price.

places.address: Meltem, Beach Park no:10, 07030 Muratpa≈üa/Antalya, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Sarƒ±su Beach-Picnic Area is a pebbly shoreline in Antalya, Turkey, offering a women-only beach experience just a few blocks from the popular Konyaalti area. It's an ideal spot for privacy-conscious Muslim ladies to enjoy the sun and sea. The beach is well-equipped with pavilions, BBQ grills, restrooms, and more.

sources.snippet: One is Sarƒ±su Women‚Äôs or Ladies Beach which means until 19.00 only ladies can use that part. Inside the ladies beach, there are some cafes and restaurants.
sources.shortName: 20 BEST BEACHES IN ANTALYA

places.name: Sarƒ±su Beach-Picnic Area

reviews.text:
Nice BBQ-zone equipped with stoves, tables, trash canes and sinks.
Also there's a beach where you can swim, relax and stay with kids.

It's the first time I visited this beach and the park. It's a good option to swim and hanging out. Not crowded and there are a lot of tables, sinks, toilets, clean spaces/ places for cooking, eating and sitting down. Also, there is a small shop where you can find types of baked goods and drinks including alcohol. But the weather is too hot when you wanna swim or take out your clothes you HAVE TO USE AN EFFECTIVE SUN SCREEN to avoid sunburn otherwise your skin would get burnt and will stings like mine nowüòíü•±.

The visiting people are mostly Turkish and a small number overseas like ME. But the people are friendly and welcoming like always. The last point, MUST WEAR YOUR SWIMMING GOGGLES BECAUSE THE WATER IS EXTREMELY SALTY.
Great picnic area. On weekends, it's hard to get free space for barbeque. On weekdays, it's relaxing and quiet but more enjoyable.

places.generalDescription: Antalya Aquarium is a popular attraction near Konyaalti Beach, offering themed exhibits, a long tunnel tank, and tropical reptiles. It's known for being the largest aquarium tunnel in the world, making it a must-visit spot for families with children. Visitors can enjoy a leisurely stroll while marveling at an impressive collection of marine life from various seas and oceans, including sharks and other aquatic animals like Sting Rays, Red Dragon Fish, and California Moray.

sources.snippet: The beach itself starts nearby the Ataturk park located near the Migros mall and the Antalya Aquarium and it extends for more than six kilometers Antalya seaport Liman. It is very easy and convenient to get to using any bus that stops in Konyaalti.
sources.shortName: The best beach of Antalya I Konyaalti Beach

places.name: Antalya Aquarium

reviews.text: The aquarium itself was very beautiful. Nothing too different from the others we've been, but still worth to visit if you're there. But the kids were absolutely amazed with the snow room. It's tiny, but has a few ice slides and a cosy little cafeteria.

Overpriced, unfriendly staff, and just not worth it

We were really disappointed with this visit. The aquarium is small for the price-yes, there are some nice fish, but definitely not enough to justify the cost. Not many sharks either, and the so-called ‚Äúlongest tunnel‚Äù wasn't anything special.

What made the experience worse was the staff. They were not friendly at all, and made a fuss because we bought tickets online. It felt like they were trying to find ways to charge us more.

Also, charging kids from 3 years old is just ridiculous. For a place this size, that feels greedy more than anything else.

Unless you get in at a heavily discounted price, I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. It's clearly a ripoff.

Visited on August 15, 2025. Paid 40 dollars per person as foreing citizens for just aquarium itself. If booked online via the aquarium's official site in advance, it costs 36 dollars instead. Overall it was nice but it is a bit pricey for what it offered.
It is home to the world's largest tunnel aquarium, stretching 131 meters in length. Inside, visitors can marvel at a life-size airplane and shipwreck, while coming face to face with majestic sharks.

places.address: Minicity and Su Hotel eastern corner of Konyaaltƒ± Beach, Arapsuyu, Dumlupƒ±nar Blv. No:502, 07200 Konyaaltƒ±/Antalya, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Red & White Beach is a vibrant beach club nestled in the Lara area, celebrated for its lively ambiance and top-notch service. This popular spot features comfortable sunbeds, a beachside bar serving refreshing cocktails, and hosts regular events that keep the energy high. Visitors can enjoy the clear waters and sandy shores while indulging in delicious meals at the on-site restaurant.
places.name: Red & White Beach

reviews.text: Had my breakfast here as part of my stay at Raw Beach Hotel, it's included and pretty good! I also ordered some alcoholic drinks (paid separately), and the vibe was totally worth it. Loved the beachfront setup right by the Mediterranean Sea, perfect for relaxing and enjoying the view.

We came here two times at the end of season and it was really relaxing! It really were the best beach days ever. It wasn't overcrowded, a lovely restaurant, clean toilet, which a lovely lady cared for. We took a sun bed which also included two sun chairs and a table for two, 4 bottles of water and a fruit plate. It was a bit pricey (3000 TL) yes, something we wouldn't do every day, but we were here only for a few days. So two luxurious beach days were affordable. And it was worth it. It's a lovely place, clean and peaceful. Chill out music, but not too loud. I enjoyed it very much. There are also cheaper options. A two person sun bed for ( not sure, I guess it was 2000 TL ?) or sun chairs. The sun chairs were 400 TL for one. This place has everything that makes it a great stay.

I've been a loyal customer of Red & White Beach Club for years, and they never fail to impress. Everything about this place screams quality ‚Äì from their stunning hotel and pristine beach to the comfortable sunbeds, delicious food, perfectly made drinks, and top-notch service.

The staff go above and beyond every single time, making you feel like a valued guest rather than just another customer. The atmosphere is unmatched in Lara ‚Äì there truly is no other place like it.

If you're looking for the ultimate beach club experience where every detail is flawless, Red & White Beach Club is the place to be.

places.address: G√ºzeloba Lara Caddesi, Sahil Yolu No:208, 07230 Muratpa≈üa/Antalya, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: L'arena Beach is a popular spot for tourists in Antalya. Visitors can enjoy the sea and the view while sitting under a free beach umbrella, although it's advisable to bring your own towel as they are not provided for hygiene reasons. Upgrading to a cabana is an option for those looking for more comfort. The staff is known for being friendly and helpful, and prices are considered affordable.
places.name: Larena Beach

reviews.text:
One of the calmest and cleanest beaches I've visited in Antalya! üå¥ Peaceful vibes, international crowd, no noise, no racism ‚ú®just pure relaxation and great service. I enjoyed some fresh fruits with a beautiful view.

üöñ Only tip: plan your ride ahead, as taxis aren't always nearby.
But overall? 10/10 experience! üåü

My fianc√© and I enjoyed this beach for 2 days. The staff are friendly and helpful and the prices are affordable for a beach hangout area. You can rent a beach bungalow for 400 lira for one day which gave us a bed, table, and a hangout area right on the beachfront which seemed like a good deal. They even gave us a discount of 50 lira for the second day we used the bungalow. There are other cheaper offers for other hangout places but the bungalow was at least isolated and comfortable if you're worried about covid and being around people.

The food is average but the milkshakes are quite delicious. My gf ordered 2 different salads on different days but she was served the same salad both times so there seem to be generic things offered based upon what you order. I would not recommend the offered seafood platter because even though on the menu the price is around 60+ lira the price ended up being 180 lira and was 40% fish head which doesn't seem worth it (or tasty). The other food was ok for the prices offered but nothing to write home about. The sea is nice but if it's too windy there can be trash in the water.

I'd go back here if I come back to Turkey again.

f you're looking for the perfect mix of disappointment and regret, this ‚Äúprivate beach‚Äù has you covered ‚Äì or rather, not covered at all, since the tiny rusty umbrellas can't block a ray of sun. The water looks like it hasn't been clean since the last century, the sunbeds are ripped beyond comfort, and the ‚Äúdouble burger‚Äù comes without the meat ‚Äì apparently, they think bread is the star of the show. Oh, and the prices? A creative work of fiction. Save yourself the trip.

places.address: G√ºzeloba, Lara Cd. no : 236, 07230 Muratpa≈üa/Antalya, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Lara Beach in Antalya is a popular destination known for its clean water and amenities such as chairs, umbrellas, snacks, and showers. The beach hosts the annual Antalya Sand Festival where artists from around the world create impressive sculptures. Additionally, there are women-only beaches like Sarisu Beach with halal restaurants and shops managed by women. The International Antalya Sand Sculpture Festival takes place on this famous beach, attracting talented artists who create magnificent works using only water and sand.

sources.snippet: Known as the Turkish Riviera, Antalya is a popular destination for sun-seekers and beach enthusiasts. In this post we explore 14 beaches you have to see in Antalya!. From Konyalti Beach‚Äôs white sand with crystal clear water near Istanbul all the way south to Lara Beach on Mediterranean coast, these are some of Turkey‚Äôs most beautiful destinations that offer something special for everyone.

sources.snippet: Another popular beach in the area is the Lara Beach, which is known for its fine sand and calm waters. Other popular beaches in the Antalya area include the Mermerli Beach and the Karpuzkaldiran Beach. Regardless of which beach you choose, you are sure to find plenty of opportunities to relax, swim, and soak up the sun in Antalya.
sources.shortName: The Best Beaches in Antalya

sources.snippet: Lara Beach is the top recommended beach in Antalya, probably more so than Konyaalti, but it‚Äôs a bit further away from the Old Town, so getting there is a little less convenient. It‚Äôs about 26 kilometers if you drive, but you could, technically, walk there via a more direct route over about 16 kilometers ‚Äì but that‚Äôs a long walk!
sources.shortName: 18 Epic Beaches In Antalya

sources.snippet: Lara Beach, a recipient of the prestigious Blue Flag award, nestles in a bay on the eastern coast of Antalya. This 12-kilometer stretch of coastline unfurls beside the scenic Lara Kent Park. The beach boasts an array of hotel zones, as well as charming caf√©s and restaurants.
sources.shortName: Best beaches in Antalya

sources.snippet: Mermerli Beach is located right in the historic center of Antalya, next to the Kalei√ßi Harbor behind a cliff. It was once used as a women‚Äôs beach since it‚Äôs a bit isolated. But it then evolved into a beach for all city dwellers, and became a lifesaver for them in the heat.
sources.shortName: ANTALYA BEACHES - WHERE TO SWIM IN ANTALYA

sources.snippet: Lara Beach is one of the most popular holiday destinations in Antalya. It features a long sandy beach with many hotels and beach clubs, making it one of our favorite destinations in Antalya. Here is all you need to know about Lara Beach in 2020.
sources.shortName: Your guide to uncovering Antalya's secrets

sources.snippet: Lara Beach is a sand beach, located on the east side of the Antalya city center. It runs down to the resort town of Belek, home of many luxury all-inclusive resorts in Antalya. The entire beach is 15km long, with only 2km being public areas.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Beaches in Antalya, Turkey & Map 2024

sources.snippet: Casa Sur‚Äôs Tips: If you do not prefer the pebble beach, the sandy Lara beach is definitely for you. Besides being a public beach, there are places where you can rent nice sun beds and umbrellas for a fee. G√ºzeloba, 07230 Muratpa≈üa
sources.shortName: The most beautiful beaches of Antalya

sources.snippet: Famous for its luxury resorts and vibrant nightlife, Lara Beach is where comfort meets beauty. The beach‚Äôs long stretch of soft sands is ideal for sunbathing, while the nearby cafes and clubs keep the energy high into the night.
sources.shortName: Discover the Top 10 Must-Visit Beaches in Antalya

sources.snippet: One of the top beaches in Antalya, Lara Beach is a happening spot to enjoy your time in this Turkish city. This is a beach that is nestled about 20 KM away from the city center and is often called the gold sand beach in Turkey.
sources.shortName: 8 Beaches In Antalya That Make For A Perfect Family Getaway

sources.snippet: Lara Beach was one of the most famous beaches of Antalya city center. However, it is already overcrowded in the summer. The beach with as many sandy as you can see is the place where summer training camps are usually set.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Antalya, Where to Swim? ‚ÄìToursce

sources.shortName: Explore the most prominent beaches of Antalya

sources.snippet: Lara beaches are the only sandy beaches in the center of Antalya. There are many private beaches in this area and you can find an option for every budget.
sources.shortName: 20 BEST BEACHES IN ANTALYA

Discovering Antalya‚Äôs Beaches: A Comprehensive Guide

places.name: Lara Beach

reviews.text: The best place ever!! The food is amazing, very Turkish food and the restaurants is very clean and ready for a lot of people all together. You can eat all the time you want day and night. For the children is very nice for entertainment at the baby club, after dinner and during the time close to the pool.

Lara Beach vs Konyaalti Beach: Lara wins for me! üåü The sandy shore beats Konyaalti's pebbled beach any day. Plus, Lara's sunset views are simply stunning - the reflection on the sand is breathtaking! üåÖ Konyaalti just can't compete with that. üëç Lara Beach is my top pick in Antalya!

Good beach, relatively clean, plenty of picnic and bbq areas at the back of the beach, lots of beach clubs/bars.
Red and White beach club was my favourite but mist are also good.

places.generalDescription: Omi Beach is a vibrant beach club located in Antalya, perfect for those seeking a lively day by the sea. With its comfortable sunbeds and an inviting beachside restaurant, it‚Äôs an ideal spot to unwind while enjoying delicious meals like pizza and spaghetti. The attentive staff adds to the welcoming atmosphere, ensuring guests feel right at home. Families will appreciate the amenities available, including bathrooms, showers, and play areas for kids.
places.name: Omi Beach

reviews.text:
I would recommend taking the Breakfast.
They have really good Service. The Restaurant is now renovated and you can sit indoor or Outdoor.

Had a really nice pizza on Saturday afternoon with my two girls and spent the afternoon snorkelling in their cordoned off swimming area.  Staff attentive, no problem getting loungers when we arrived but thinner on the ground between 1-2pm.

Horrible service. We ordered food, waited for 45 min, and then they said 5 more minutes and then 5 more minutes. We waited an hour and they kept telling us sorry  we busy. People who came after us were already enjoying their meal. We canceled our order.

places.generalDescription: Olympos spor kulubu is a popular destination for hikers in the Olympos mountain massif. The Chimaera flames, located on a steep slope near the Mediterranean coast, have been igniting and releasing methane gas from the ground since ancient times. It's a unique natural phenomenon that attracts visitors looking to witness this mesmerizing display of flames amidst the stunning natural surroundings.

sources.snippet: Olympos region is not only famous with its bungalows andancient city. There is also the Olympos Beach, which you can reach through theancient city, and marvel at its beautiful nature and serene environment. Put iton your list especially if you like history!.
sources.shortName: Advice for First Time Visitors to Antalya: Antalya Beaches Akka Blog

places.name: Olympos spor kulubu

sources.shortName: Discovering Antalya‚Äôs Beaches: A Comprehensive Guide
Your guide to uncovering Antalya's secrets

reviews.text:
Came here during the night for a walk and it was very peaceful.

Can't comment on what the beach is like during the day.

Mainly enclosed for the hotel sections on the beach.You just have to be careful for the jellyfish.There are some but this lifeguards do look out.
And remove them

This is the reality behind the ¬´¬†nice¬†¬ª beach clubs. We were very shocked by the state of the beach all along the walking area. + the water looks extremely dirty as well. We came all the way from the old town and left in 10m. Not worth the visit !

places.generalDescription: Sarƒ±su Kadƒ±nlar Plajƒ± is a picturesque beach that opens daily from 11th June, offering free entry and clear sea waters perfect for spotting fish. Accessible by bus, it's located near Sarisu Depolama with a short walk to the entrance. The beach provides sunbed and umbrella rentals, clean shower facilities, and a car park. It's exclusively for women until 6pm when it becomes mixed-gender.
places.name: Sarƒ±su Kadƒ±nlar Plajƒ±

reviews.text: Great spot for barbeque, get together and fun with a group. Basic setups for doing barbeque already exists there. The sound of waves add more to the serenity.

Beach is about a 10-minute walk from the last bus stop. Right now, since it's off-season, is less crowded, the beach is peaceful and beautiful. However, during the summer, it gets extremely crowded, and finding a spot might be difficult. It's a great place to spend time with a family/friends and have a barbecue.

Very nice beach and scenery, but rating the whole experience - overall it is too expensive. I thought it will be a place for local turkish people, but it's not price-wise. The sunbed costs 200 lira and big water 40 lira. Plus if you arrive by bus its a bit of walk to get to the beach. I prefer beach closet to Antalya.

places.generalDescription: Adalar Beach Club is a unique spot located just over 2 km from the city center, offering a paid area with platforms on the rocks, toilets, showers, changing rooms, and sunbeds. The beach bar provides a relaxed atmosphere with outdoor seating and stunning views of the Mediterranean Sea. Guests can enjoy late-night food and drinks along with live music or DJ sets.

sources.snippet: Adalar Beach, nestled beside the iconic Twin Rocks, is situated in one of the most picturesque spots along the coast - within the lush confines of Karaalioglu Park in Antalya. This serene haven is a must-visit for anyone planning a beach vacation in Turkey, offering a perfect blend of natural beauty and tranquil waters.
sources.shortName: Best beaches in Antalya

places.name: Adalar Beach Club

reviews.text: Very friendly staff. Nice secluded spot with clean water, which was great for a swim. 300 lira for the sunbed and drinks served to where you are sitting. I have tried most of the local beaches, and this was my favourite and the cheapest too. Good atmosphere, too.

Had a lovely time here just chilling and soaking up the sun staff were friendly and scenery was great . One down side is if you're not a great swimmer this is a fairly risky swimming spot rocky all around and quite shallow in spots so when the tide goes out I cut my foot off of the rocky seabed but just swim out past the rocks and you'll be fine. As for the price ? 400tl entrance fee but the drinks were averagely priced in comparison to other places although I'm not sure of the alcohol level in the drinks seemed light to me but I'm Irish that could be just my tolerance level üòÅ

A hidden gem. Cozy private beach, friendly and helpful staff. They offer a choice of drinks and even complete meals like K√∂fte with salad and fries. Clean changing rooms and toilets are available. Positive atmosphere. A great alternative to the stony Konyaalti beach. For one day incl. sunbed, towel and one drink I paid approx. 20 EUR. Good value for money
